storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to configure my preferred alert channels to receive scheduling conflict notifications effectively

testCases.title: Validate alert channel preference saving
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Scheduler is logged into the system
Alert preferences feature is enabled
User has valid email address and phone number available

steps.action: Navigate to the alert preferences page from the user settings menu
steps.expectedResult: Alert preferences UI is displayed showing available channel options (email, SMS, in-app) and current settings

steps.action: Select the email checkbox and enter a valid email address in the email field
steps.expectedResult: Email checkbox is checked and email input field accepts the valid email format without validation errors

steps.action: Select the SMS checkbox and enter a valid phone number in the SMS field
steps.expectedResult: SMS checkbox is checked and phone number input field accepts the valid phone format without validation errors

steps.action: Click the 'Save Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays a success confirmation message indicating preferences have been saved successfully

steps.action: Refresh the alert preferences page
steps.expectedResult: Previously saved preferences (email and SMS channels with contact information) are displayed correctly

postconditions: Alert preferences are persisted in the user preferences database
Email and SMS channels are active for the scheduler
Future alerts will be sent via configured channels

testCases.title: Verify alerts sent via configured channels
preconditions: Scheduler has configured alert preferences with email and SMS channels enabled
Valid email address and phone number are saved in preferences
Email and SMS notification services are operational
Test scheduling conflict scenario is available to trigger

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by double-booking a resource or creating overlapping schedules
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and triggers the alert mechanism

steps.action: Wait for alert delivery (maximum 2 seconds as per success metrics)
steps.expectedResult: Alert is sent to both email and SMS channels within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check the configured email inbox for the alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received containing scheduling conflict details with timestamp and conflict information

steps.action: Check the configured phone number for SMS alert notification
steps.expectedResult: SMS alert is received containing scheduling conflict summary with relevant details

steps.action: Verify that in-app notification was NOT received (since it was not configured)
steps.expectedResult: No in-app notification is displayed, confirming alerts are sent only via configured channels

postconditions: Scheduler has received alerts on both configured channels
Alert delivery is logged in the system
Scheduling conflict remains active until resolved

testCases.title: Test validation of invalid contact info
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged into the system
Alert preferences page is accessible
Email and SMS channels are available for configuration

steps.action: Navigate to the alert preferences page
steps.expectedResult: Alert preferences UI is displayed with input fields for contact information

steps.action: Select the email checkbox and enter an invalid email format (e.g., 'invalidemail@')
steps.expectedResult: Email input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Click the 'Save Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating invalid email format, and preferences are not saved

steps.action: Correct the email address to a valid format (e.g., 'scheduler@example.com')
steps.expectedResult: Email input field accepts the valid email and validation error is cleared

steps.action: Select the SMS checkbox and enter an invalid phone number format (e.g., '123')
steps.expectedResult: Phone number input field accepts the text entry

steps.action: Click the 'Save Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating invalid phone number format, and preferences are not saved

steps.action: Correct the phone number to a valid format (e.g., '+1234567890')
steps.expectedResult: Phone number input field accepts the valid number and validation error is cleared

steps.action: Click the 'Save Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success confirmation message and preferences are saved successfully

postconditions: Valid contact information is saved in user preferences
Invalid data was rejected and not persisted
User received clear validation feedback

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive escalation alerts for unresolved scheduling conflicts to ensure timely resolution

testCases.title: Verify escalation alert after unresolved conflict threshold
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Escalation feature is enabled in the system
Escalation threshold is configured (e.g., 30 minutes)
Designated higher-level users are configured for escalation
Alert channels are configured for both scheduler and escalation recipients
System time can be manipulated or waited for testing purposes

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by double-booking a resource
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and records the conflict creation timestamp

steps.action: Verify that initial alert is sent to the scheduler
steps.expectedResult: Initial conflict alert is received by the scheduler via configured channels with conflict details

steps.action: Leave the conflict unresolved and wait until the escalation threshold time passes (or advance system time)
steps.expectedResult: Escalation threshold is reached without conflict resolution

steps.action: Monitor for escalation alert delivery within 1 minute of threshold
steps.expectedResult: Escalation alert is sent to designated higher-level users within 1 minute of threshold being reached

steps.action: Verify escalation alert content received by higher-level users
steps.expectedResult: Escalation alert contains detailed conflict information including original alert time, duration unresolved, and conflict details

steps.action: Resolve the scheduling conflict by removing the double-booking
steps.expectedResult: System marks the conflict as resolved and records resolution timestamp

steps.action: Monitor for any additional escalation alerts after conflict resolution
steps.expectedResult: No further escalation alerts are sent after the conflict is resolved

postconditions: Conflict is resolved in the system
Escalation alerts have ceased
Escalation event is logged in audit trail
Conflict duration is recorded accurately

testCases.title: Check audit logging of escalation events
preconditions: Audit logging feature is enabled
User has permissions to view audit logs
Escalation feature is configured and operational
At least one unresolved conflict exists that can trigger escalation

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict and wait for escalation threshold to pass
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is created and escalation threshold is reached

steps.action: Verify that escalation alert is triggered and sent to designated users
steps.expectedResult: Escalation alert is sent successfully to higher-level users

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section of the system
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Filter audit logs for escalation events related to the triggered conflict
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entries for the escalation event are displayed

steps.action: Review the escalation event log entry details
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains accurate timestamp of escalation, conflict ID, scheduler user details, escalated-to user details, and escalation reason

steps.action: Verify the timestamp accuracy in the audit log
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp in audit log matches the actual time when escalation alert was triggered (within acceptable margin)

steps.action: Check that all required fields are populated in the audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains complete information including event type, user IDs, conflict details, and escalation level

steps.action: Resolve the conflict and verify resolution is also logged
steps.expectedResult: Conflict resolution event is logged with timestamp and user who resolved it

postconditions: Complete audit trail exists for the escalation event
Audit logs accurately reflect escalation history
Logs are available for compliance and reporting purposes

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive detailed conflict information in alerts to understand and resolve issues effectively

testCases.title: Verify detailed conflict information in alerts
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged into the system
Scheduler has valid email address configured for notifications
In-app notification system is enabled
At least two bookings exist that create a scheduling conflict
Notification service is operational
User has appropriate permissions to view booking details

steps.action: Create or identify a scheduling conflict by attempting to book the same resource for overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and triggers conflict detection mechanism

steps.action: Wait for conflict alert to be generated
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Review the alert content received via in-app notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert contains all required details: booking IDs of conflicting bookings, resource names involved in conflict, conflicting time slots with start and end times, and suggested resolution steps

steps.action: Verify the booking IDs displayed in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Both conflicting booking IDs are clearly displayed and match the actual conflicting bookings in the system

steps.action: Verify the resource names displayed in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Resource names are accurate and match the resources involved in the conflict

steps.action: Verify the time slots displayed in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Time slots show exact start and end times for both conflicting bookings in a clear, readable format

steps.action: Check email inbox for the same conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received with identical conflict information

steps.action: Review the email alert formatting and content structure
steps.expectedResult: Email alert content is clear, well-formatted, and easy to read with proper spacing, headers, and organized sections for booking IDs, resources, times, and suggested actions

steps.action: Compare in-app notification format with email notification format
steps.expectedResult: Both notification channels display the same information with appropriate formatting for each medium

steps.action: Locate and identify the clickable link to the first conflicting booking in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Link is clearly visible and properly labeled with the booking ID or descriptive text

steps.action: Click on the link to the first conflicting booking
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the booking details page for the first conflicting booking in the UI

steps.action: Verify the booking details page displays correct information matching the alert
steps.expectedResult: Booking details page shows the same booking ID, resource name, and time slot as mentioned in the alert

steps.action: Navigate back to the alert and click on the link to the second conflicting booking
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the booking details page for the second conflicting booking in the UI

steps.action: Verify the second booking details page displays correct information
steps.expectedResult: Booking details page shows accurate information for the second conflicting booking matching the alert details

steps.action: Review the suggested resolution steps provided in the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert contains clear, actionable suggested resolution steps such as 'Reschedule one of the bookings', 'Select alternative resource', or 'Contact booking owner'

postconditions: Scheduler has received and reviewed detailed conflict information
Scheduler has successfully accessed both conflicting booking details via provided links
Alert remains in notification history for future reference
No system errors or performance issues occurred during alert generation and delivery
Conflict remains unresolved and available for scheduler action
